castAddBody.text: Hello, Farcaster World!
Thank you  for building Farcaster. First impression: great platform to connect with like minded people in a considerably more personal way.

Great context around that Steve Jobs quote! In that sense, brain computers, or rather neural interfaces, will be portals into the mind from which we will explore consciousness and the nature of reality.
Sharing my white paper on network, a brain computer protocol to accelerate the advent of neural interface powered dreams https://network.foundation/network.pdf

Was part of the early Thiel Foundation Summits, as I did not pass the age requirement for the fellowship and that's actually why I moved to SF Bay Area to be part of this network. This is a good write up: https://www.quora.com/What-is-it-like-to-attend-the-Thiel-Foundation-Summit
All the Walter Isaacson ones are great. Albert Einstein, Leonardo da Vinci, Benjamin Franklin, Steve Jobs and soon Elon Musk.
Probably moving to America in 2008. There were many great people along the way that catalyzed my growth. Meeting Niall Ferguson in 2011 or Elon Musk in 2013 come to mind.
Dreams are real.
Eckhart Tolle has a great podcast hosted by Oprah called Essential Teachings https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/eckhart-tolle-essential-teachings/id1458654443
Elon Musk recently recommended this podcast that has revolutions as its core topic https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/revolutions/id703889772

It was at a secret gathering that I promised not to talk about. Another person that comes to mind was Jack Dorsey in 2015, when he came to speak at my university. By meeting these people I suppose meeting them in real life enabled me to dream big and actually go for it.
I've compiled a list on Goodreads with some of the best books on the topic of lucid dreaming: https://www.goodreads.com/review/list/95737422-link-daniel?shelf=dreams
This is a great three-part documentary series on Elon Musk’s trials and triumphs that just started to air on BBC with a lot of new interview material. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a5g80dHqRQE
What is the origin story for the Farcaster name
In the world of Hyperion Cantos, a farcaster “is a means of transportation which allows one to travel immense distances instantaneously, without any time delay.”
There is a bit of the backstory on Dan’s blog: https://danromero.org/farcaster
Sure thanks linkdaniel.eth
Thanks
I’ve talked a bit about my immigrant story during a fireside chat in New York at CryptoMondays. Here is the video: https://youtu.be/op2z4D31mOc

Actually sufficiently decentralized is a great term   because it also puts into focus that what matters is making the product relatable and usable for everyday people who do not care about any technical, crypto-economic concepts.

Once upon a time on the streets of San Francisco, I approach an early stage investor of SpaceX and Tesla whom I recognize about my dream of a neural interface powered dream world. He looks at me perplexed and says: “Why are you doing this? Straight out of the Matrix.”
Jack has made it very clear though to disrupt the existing paradigm and  made it his mission to build an open protocol.
Work while you sleep in your lucid dreams.

Well I cannot speak for him but I reckon he wants to build a viable alternative and he understands this cannot be realized through existing platform. Some will want to stay and try to upgrade the old horse. I think its hard to build novel incentives into existing infrastructure.
Well said . Actual conversations and people with an optimistic outlook and build mindset.

That being said, I still think especially leadership by Elon can fundamentally improve the experience and make it more useful on different verticals as he had suggested via the X.com vision. Less crypto, but that’s what matters in the end to build a great product.
https://i.imgur.com/CfwXrRs.png
There were also some good parts to this interview of Zuck by Tim Ferriss earlier this year https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x-kALfaofek
Who here is generally interested in lucid dreaming and dream engineering

Yes good analogy hence my reply following that one farcaster://casts/0x4323628efeefd982efe2ebdbdfad19a5ae1ba23e4d39c662e5c172bd6f3e31df/0x39f9a15481ee80f42eb23520a9beac28c2c291ea15d7a4f91088707fd7d40bcf
How do you envision an MVP for that
You might enjoy this publication called Startup Cities by zach.dev https://www.startupcities.com/

Startup Cities by zach.dev shares some great perspective on how to build new cities

https://www.startupcities.com/
I think that’s why smart contract wallets like Argent are important. Vitalik wrote about this: https://vitalik.ca/general/2021/01/11/recovery.html

That’s a good point. I guess I thought if there is an additional layer like there is with smart contract wallets the wallet could enable some type of filter that screens for commonly known malicious transactions.
Yes, that’s the challenge as the list is constantly growing. It would definitely be better to use a collective approach vs right now the the burden falls on the individual to figure this out.

It’s a good approach. Status has implemented this albeit without shuffling although you could choose a wallet until you find one you like. You can also get a Status ENS subdomain after that. https://status.im/
Focus Plant does this in some way by planting virtual plants the longer you stay focused and away from phone: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/focus-plant-pomodoro-forest/id1459096306
This reminds me of this book: Thinking in Systems by Donella Meadows https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/3828902
If you want to go alone, go fast. If you want to go far, go farcasting.
Original African proverb: "If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together."

I have some invites to Lex, the AI writing tool. Feel free to respond if you would like access.

https://lex.page
I've written a white paper that has lucid dreaming as one of its core concepts that is part of a network we have been working towards to https://network.fund/network.pdf
This is quite good and I like that it brings you back to Farcaster when you find a query you like.
https://lex.page/invites/YVRSGSDG
https://lex.page/invites/GALUKCYB
https://lex.page/invites/SZLOCOVQ
https://lex.page/invites/WDLKPKCU
https://lex.page/invites/KJUKRJGY
I ran out of invites but I messaged Nathan. If I get more invites, I'll let you know.
One thing is to rebuild social media as it exists using Web3 primitives. Another is evolving it into something entirely new with novel incentive mechanisms.
What are some of your favorite plugins
Thanks for sharing that
if you still have invites  was interested
Williamsburg, Dumbo, Bushwick are neighborhoods where you can find people and projects that are based there.
What does the metaverse mean to you?
Can you expand on that
If you could build an emergent, new city in America, where would you build it and why?
The Network State Dashboard  https://thenetworkstate.com/dashboard
PC + Warcraft III and World of Warcraft. I consider this special training as important as my education.
What properties that do not exist in the current world draw you to a network state?
How did you experience that insight
Chip War by Chris Miller is a great and recent one. https://i.imgur.com/ZG2FjKW.jpg

This is a great conversation between Niall Ferguson and Chris Miller hosted by the Commonwealth Club on an important topic based on his recent book Chip War which is about the history of microchip technology https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IiYO_gHtRLI
Leonardo da Vinci. Galileo Galilei. Benjamin Franklin. I suppose generally anyone regarded as a Renaissance Man or polymath.
Makes it evident how important it is to build the next computing platform not as a walled garden and not allow incumbents to curtail innovation.

Steve Jobs used to say he was at the intersection of technology and liberal arts. In his words: “Technology alone is not enough. It’s technology married with liberal arts, married with the humanities, that yields us the results that make our heart sing.”

What app do you use for personal productivity?

 a long time ago had written this great guide on productivity, in which he recommends to only keep three lists: a Todo List, a Watch List, and a Later List.

https://pmarchive.com/guide_to_personal_productivity.html

I'm also a proponent of keeping it simple, because a lot of these apps add (unnecessary) complexity. This also applies to note taking. A lot of these apps add a considerable overhead to maintain this kind of organization.
It's going to be neural interfaces which will enable virtual worlds and the metaverse will be one of those worlds.
There is a great quote that goes with this by Charlie Munger: “Show me the incentive and I will show you the outcome."

Great reminder by Steve Jobs that you have to be willing to act and keep going regardless of whether or not it works yet. Something that everyone knows yet it’s still hard to do. 

https://youtu.be/zkTf0LmDqKI
This also a great clip by Laurene Powell Jobs on the notion that Steve Jobs always relayed to people that you can actually change more than you realize. https://youtu.be/sdvzYtgmIjs

This is the clip directly by Steve Jobs sharing that insight.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kYfNvmF0Bqw
It’s a great space and environment, which has somewhat of a startup ecosystem last time I was there.
Clarity https://clarity.so is a DAO contribution platform

That’s a great aspect to Farcaster that you can get feedback. Other broading social media either have too much spam or the focus is on prestige where the goal of the poster is to get as much attention as possible.
Elon is in charge of Twitter now. How would you describe the change that he will drive in one or two words?
Insanely dynamic
What exists today will be seen as a dial-up modem important as a stepping stone paving the way for true virtual reality powered by neural interfaces.

Or it might be someone else entirely. 
A newcomer like SpaceX.
Physics and Subconscious is also a great track from the Inception Recording Sessions
Bitcoin white paper in one image https://i.imgur.com/4cfjoc3.jpg
This is referred to as hypnagogia, a transitional state from wakefulness to sleep https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypnagogia
The Steve Jobs analogy that computers are bicycles for the mind in video format https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rTRzYjoZhIY
I agree the industry has not set a good example yet for governance. However regulators have also failed to provide guidelines and frameworks for navigating through this world in a compliant manner.

How do you build a new market without capital? I've been experimenting around that question for a long time. It's actually the most difficult path. Perhaps like Urbit you need to have a startup company that kickstarts development. Open to any feedback.

Peter Thiel speaks with Uncommon Knowledge's Peter Robinson in Florence, Italy hosted by Hoover Institution
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OWXFdEyOKc4

On the path towards fair & transparent defi markets and the open metaverse there will be many bosses like in a game that need to be slayed. We need to rejoice when we have moved closer towards that vision even when it comes with short-term pain for everyone.
Yes exactly although there are not many that have taken that path Satoshi being the notable exception.
"If you want to know what will happen five years from now you look at the fringe." — Steve Jobs
What we have to remember is that money is as much a social construct as it is technological innovation.

The parable of Mr. Market often shared by Warren Buffett, which he had learned from Ben Graham, is worth remembering. While in the short run the market is a voting machine, in the long run it is a weighing machine. 

https://fs.blog/mr-market/

What I appreciate most about  is his sense of optimism. 

In his words: “The world is a very malleable place. If you know what you want, and you go for it with maximum energy and drive and passion, the world will often reconfigure itself around you much more quickly and easily than you would think.”
Paragraph (https://paragraph.xyz) created by  is also great.

In 2019 at Stanford’s Blockchain Conference I asked you about the evolution of fundraising mechanisms and you had mentioned quadratic funding. Curious how your view on bootstrapping networks has evolved given current regulatory environment makes building without token sale the only plausible path these days
Surprised nobody has mentioned World of Warcraft yet. It was quite the immersive experience at the time. I suppose depends how you define futuristic.
A video played from my memory upon waking fetching information from my dreams.
What future excites you that is currently not reality?

I’ll start: A world in which you can use your neural interface to explore your dreams like you can today in a lucid dream yet in a more permanent state through which you can heal yourself and find freedom from the loops that govern your life.

"The other cliche goes like this this; live each day as if it were your last. The best way to take this advice is to do exactly the opposite: live each day as if you would live forever." — Peter Thiel

I think the whole notion of follow / unfollow is broken. Its part of the broadcasting element of social media where the main goal is prestige. I hope we can innovate on this because people define themselves or others based on who you follow.
Suppose it has been said in some way already. Define a recurring, daily use case for a niche audience. This is probably important and difficult for any startup.

For starters and for existing social media networks that can’t move beyond the broadcasting element, make follow/ unfollow less prominent. Curation of the feed should come from liking, not whom you follow/ unfollow. This is already the case to some extent. I think follow/unfollow feels unnatural and caters to prestig

Yes the goal is a feed that you want to return to with highest signal. I think constantly following and unfollowing feels like an unnecessary job that just caters to the prestige game. Curation should come more from the kind of content you engage with and you also want to have a feed that challenges your worldview.
The network state is already here. It’s just not recognized yet.
I've compiled a post with officially released information by Neuralink that I could find as of December 2022 https://paragraph.xyz/@network/all-things-neuralink

I agree with your assessment of nature as wilderness and the advantages to moving away from it. I would also say that nature has a larger definition, as in nature is also what we cannot see. In terms of consciousness the nature of reality is yet to be explored.
Congrats

Open invitation to anyone on Farcaster to join the Network community:

https://t.me/networkfund
https://network.fund/discord

At Network, we are building a market for neural interface technologies in order to create software to connect you to the dream world.
Wondering if you are also planning to integrate Apple Pencil support for iPad to draw sketches. Right now it seems you can only convert (what Apple calls Scribble) handwritten text into type.

"If you just sit and observe, you will see how restless your mind is… when it does [calm], there's room to hear more subtle things that's when your intuition starts to blossom and you start to see things more clearly... Your mind just slows down and you see a tremendous expanse in the moment." — Steve Jobs
Just reconnected address. I remember on the desktop app the address was visible in the past. It shows as you have described both web and iOS plus says v2, as well. I guess it went through then.

Even though I haven’t posted much yet, I am grateful for  and  to continue build this platform and innovate on what social media and networking could become. We definitely need censorship resistant platforms that support freedom of speech.
Thinking of flying to Paris for EthCC without a ticket. Very least I can visit this cafe.
Thanks. Just signed up.
Thanks

Channels are great. I think it would be good to eventually allow everyone to create channels. Lots of ways to configure from private to temporary and ephemeral ones. I’m sure you already have that planned :)
Open to feedback to build an economy and market for the dream world in order to make life multi-reality. Need to figure out a way to create a forcing function for dream exploration technologies.
Alternative models that don’t require that much capital and could use a token to incentivize the creation of a network that would fund and develop towards neural interface powered dreams.

SpaceX had capital for multiple attempts to show they can fly to orbit. The contract from NASA then allowed them to perfect reusable rockets. How this could be done in an alternative way without this amount of capital.
I would create a channel for dream exploration technologies and more generally neuroscience technology
Onchain is a better term than Web3. More on par with internet as a word and indicates something new rather than Web3 which sounds like a better version of the existing world wide web.
Well yes I’ve met her a few years ago. She’s cool.
I do like the design of Coinbase Wallet. The only thing is it does not feel that secure with only 12 word seedphrase and no additional security measures.
Yes sure that does not make it that much more secure compared to something like Argent and also most people generate a wallet from the Coinbase Wallet app and that way it generates 12 words.

The problem is that as we corrupted social networks with advertising we have forgotten what it is about. Today it is mainly about social media, broadcasting and farming attention. Instead of it being about finding connections in terms of ideas, people and opportunities.
Reminds me of the Leonardo da Vinci quote: “Man is the image of the world.”
What are the best resources to read up on to figure out how to bootstrap and fund a new market

Yes, like a crowded WoW server people will flock elsewhere. We need more top tier global cities anyway. US also has this problem. Used to be only SF, NY and LA more or less. Perhaps now Austin and Miami added. But why? Such a big country. Way better to have more than just a few established cities.
Ephemeral ones that anyone or most active ones can host
Way to go

Found these words by  from 2018 to be a good reminder:

"If crypto succeeds, it's not because it empowers better people, it's because it empowers better institutions, better incentive structures, and better ways for people to interact with each other."

From that view, have we made progress?
Elon Musk

Discuss

> Of course, the Internet is the child of America, just as America was the child of the UK. But it’s becoming something different. A successor that exceeds its worthy progenitor.

Posted by  

https://x.com/balajis/status/1702483655804002712
Life is a dream
As an experiment for onchain identity, with the remaining invite I registered an account with my full legal name  as a proof of identity.
I’m thinking if Elon would build a network state, he would build it in America and transform the United States with much better immigration policies, infrastructure and upward social mobility.
Join the  for dream exploration technologies and accelerate the advent of neural interface powered dreams. Be part of the movement to build the network state of the dream world.
Farcaster becoming fully permissionless is a great milestone to have achieved. Congrats  and  plus the entire Warpcast team         @adityapk @horsefacts.eth

The Network State Amsterdam hosted by  on Oct 30, 2023  Meetup / Side Events List. Let's post them all in one place. If you plan on going, feel also free to reply and / or say why you're interested in network states.
What do you like the most about Farcaster?
https://warpcast.com/grin/0x1f753c9c

Satoshi Nakamoto saying that cryptography leads to new territory of freedom and that freedom I think may give rise to network states.

SN: “You will not find a solution to political problems in cryptography...Yes, but we can win a major battle in the arms race and gain a new territory of freedom for several years.”

“Money is a fundamentally social thing in a much deeper way than, say, two-party encrypted communication. You have to start thinking about governance, social contracts… common shared expectations in this community.”

A Declaration of the Independence of Cyberspace
https://www.eff.org/cyberspace-independence

I’d like to speak about the dream state as a network state  and dreams as the second global state of consciousness. Conscious dreaming has been scientifically established for decades. Who among casters would be interested to watch this kind of address?

Thinking of issuing a dream art passport NFT for the neural network state in the wake of the network state conference. This would just be art for now but in the future as the dream state comes into reality the passport could be further enhanced by holding certain rights. Who would be interested in that?
netxork.com x.com/netxork
Network State Meetup Amsterdam post The Network State Conference on Tuesday evening https://lu.ma/0plhklto

Just finished reading your Anthology by Eric Jorgenson. So many good lessons, ideas and thoughts in there. I’ve created a post conference meetup for Tuesday evening. If you sign up, I can add you as a host and / or we could also do another one on Wednesday.

The projected buildup by SpaceX for a Mars base
Internet first by  https://x.com/balajis/status/1760197078708531576
“Tokens are assets that are used to power virtual economies.”

Now is the time to reimagine what networks can be, concludes  with a personal touch in his own voice at the end of the Read Write Own audiobook. Indeed we need to use imagination to build a new world and principles that have stood the time of history to ensure liberty for the people.
Martian Technocracy https://x.com/elonmusk/status/1762033996098379956

Read Write Own details the history of networks and heeds the lessons of the internet for those that may follow in building the networks of the future. It is important to build future networks on a strong foundation aligned with proper values and principles.
What we do in life echoes in eternity
To give power back to the people of Rome
The network state of the dreamworld
Freedom of speech also means being free to express yourself and not being fearful of what others say or think.
The great thing about Farcaster is that it removes many fears that are prevalent on more centralized counterparts. If you are afraid of being censored, you are not really able to express yourself.
